programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: A Boys School With A Dark Past & More

programme.title: The UnXplained with William Shatner
programme.desc: An exploration of subjects that have mystified mankind for centuries, with the host shedding light on how the seemingly impossible can sometimes happen. Here, the veteran actor reflects on some remarkable tales of human survival against all the odds. Do such events reveal that humans have a hidden reserve of inexplicable energy locked away that only gets released when the situation calls for it?.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The Landrys put family pride on the line, Willie ventures into mysterious territory, while Kristi answers a call for help. Series following American alligator hunters.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: Tyler McLaughlin struggles to hold on to his position in third place as the leading two boats leap ahead, while the pressure takes its toll on Dave Marciano.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: The bladesmiths hope to recreate the famous battle sword wielded by Napoleon. Plus, they turn a ladder into a set of Damascus knives.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: The team restores a fire-damaged car, while another project gets Danny in trouble with the police.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank visit rural Minnesota, where they meet antiques collectors and examine vintage peep show machines.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets tasks to comics including Mel Giedroyc and Noel Fielding, with Alex Horne and Noel Fielding dancing like a pair of shrews.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy show, with Ellie Taylor, Josh Widdicombe, Rob Beckett and James Acaster joining regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons to give their irreverent takes on the biggest stories to hit the headlines hit the headlines in October 2015, through stand-up spots and improvised games. Chaired by Dara O Briain.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner presents the comedy panel show, which sees veteran broadcaster Terry Wogan, cricketer-turned-TV personality Phil Tufnell and writer, presenter and poker player Victoria Coren Mitchell compete to have their pet hates banished for ever. Their gripes include food packaging, health fads, the 1990s Australian cricket team, hors d'oeuvres and people who walk around changing rooms naked.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner chairs the comedy panel show, inviting comedian Greg Davies, presenter and adventurer Ben Fogle and journalist Janet Street-Porter to compete to have their pet hates banished for ever. Their gripes include people who use suitcases on wheels, multichannel TV, umbrellas, friends' hobbies and women who like to be treated as ladies.

programme.title: Rhod Gilbert's Work Experience
programme.desc: The comedian undertakes a work placement at the Welsh Mountain Zoo near Colwyn Bay, Conwy, where his tasks include looking after tigers, sea lions and monkeys. However, Rhod struggles to remember the exotic creatures' names, let alone how to take care of them.

programme.title: Rhod Gilbert's Work Experience
programme.desc: The comedian continues to sample a wide variety of jobs, this week donning make-up and a dress to become a drag artist. Coached by one of the country's leading performers, he faces the daunting challenge of appearing on stage dressed as a woman in front of a packed audience.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a car auction business. A near-perfect 50s Chevy panel van and a very desirable low-mileage 80s Brooklands Capri tempt auctioneer Derek out of Yorkshire.

programme.title: Hidden Traces
programme.desc: Personal items unearthed from the Normandy Landings and the discovery of a set of underground tunnels used in the attack.

programme.title: Hidden Traces
programme.desc: A look at the downfall of Imperial Japan and the first use of an atomic bomb, featuring testimonies from survivors, archaeological findings, and CGI reconstructions.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Penny gives Hugh an ultimatum about their relationship, while Meryl and Betty land Hugh as their star attraction at the first Whyhope speed dating night.

programme.title: The Last Post
programme.desc: Drama about military police and their families faced with political and personal conflicts in a 1960s British colony on the Red Sea coast. An officer and his wife arrive in Aden, where he is to replace a much-loved captain. He soon has to adjust to life on the frontline, along with resentment among the men that he was appointed instead of the already-present Lt Ed Laithwaite. Honor is taken under the wing of Laithwaite's wife, Alison, who had been having an affair with Captain Page. Starring Jessie Buckley and Jeremy Neumark Jones.

programme.title: The Last Post
programme.desc: Mary goes into labour while her husband has left the city to rendezvous with the SAS, who are returning to Aden after a secret mission to capture a dangerous fugitive. When things go badly wrong, Harry must choose between his men and his family. An American reporter ingratiates herself with the troops, to Joe's annoyance, and Honor joins an exclusive club.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Hotspots: On the Frontline
programme.desc: Alex Crawford investigates the illegal plastics trade in Kenya, and Stuart Ramsay is in the Amazon where wildfires are devastating landscapes and livelihoods.

programme.title: Sophy Ridge on Sunday
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest news headlines, plus analysis of current affairs issues with leading politicians, a review of stories in the day's national newspapers and weather reports.

programme.title: John Bishop's Great Whale Rescue
programme.desc: Part two of two. John's mission to return Little White and Little Grey from captivity to the Icelandic beluga whale sanctuary continues, as the pair begin the 6,000-mile journey to reach their new home. Following the previous delays in China, the release is already two months behind schedule, and as autumn approaches the whales have little time to put on enough weight and acclimatise to the cold water they will face in the bay.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: FYI Extra
programme.desc: Short bulletin rounding up the day's showbusiness stories.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz show in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: Let Magic be the soundtrack to your late night listening with some of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let Kiss keep you up all night with the finest collection of RandB tunes and nocturnal beats.

programme.title: Ed Stafford: Into the Unknown
programme.desc: The renowned British explorer sets out to find the cause of some mysterious white lines in what appears to be an uninhabited area of swamp on Kimaam Island, Indonesia.

programme.title: Robson Green: Extreme Fisherman
programme.desc: The actor and angling enthusiast travels to Guatemala in Central America to catch one of the world's fastest fish on the planet, and then cooks a sharp-toothed sierra mackerel with the Garifuna people.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Building custom motorcycles with the gang at Orange County Choppers.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: One of the tallest buildings in Suffolk gets knocked down. Plus, metal worker Neil creates a dining table out of old ambulance and motorcycle parts..

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: Documentary focusing on Wind Surf, the largest sailing yacht in the world, which is large enough to accommodate 312 guests, yet small enough to tuck into tiny harbours.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacturing processes involved in the production of vinyl records, bagels, cedar canoes and chains.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacture of windscreens, saddles and electric guitars.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: When a killer's dumping ground is discovered in Florida, investigators set out to confirm the identity of charred bones in order to solve the brutal crime.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Surya Toha, who vanished in March 2010 after dropping her two boys at school in Coral Springs, Florida. Chilling CCTV footage revealed exactly what happened to her.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case from Walsenburg, Colorado, in which a frantic emergency telephone call to help a neighbour ended in a bizarre investigation, complete with a twisted tale of torture and family secrets.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: Detectives join forces with local police when two girls go missing from a small California town.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: An investigator has to act quickly to save the pups of a dog that has given birth in an alley, and a medical technician tries to save the life of an injured bird.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A West Highland Terrier called Chester dislikes skateboarders. Concerned that he will bite someone, his owners take him to see Chris to see if he can help tame him.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A woman's brash mother causes her bridesmaids to feel self-conscious in their dresses, giving consultant Nikky a lot of work to do.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Shana and Edwina bring their 'Golden Girls' chic to Riverside, California. A messy unit catches Dave's attention, while Rene switches from buying to selling.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Mary dabbles with Dave's dark arts in Torrence, California, Kenny takes some excavation lessons, while Brandi and Jarrod to stumble across a wartime oddity.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: TV doctor Christian Jessen, actor and presenter Warwick Davis and writer and broadcaster Victoria Coren Mitchell tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include doctors, James Bond and people who send e-mails.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Nurse Gladys Emmanuel's washing-machine breaks down, and Arkwright decides to try and lure her into his home with the offer of his vintage machine.

programme.title: News, Sport, Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest news and sports headlines, plus weather forecasts.

programme.title: News, Sport, Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest news and sports headlines, plus weather forecasts.

programme.title: Too Close
programme.desc: Forensic psychiatrist Emma Robertson is assigned to work with Connie Mortensen, a wife and mother accused of a despicable crime. Her assessment of the woman's sanity will determine whether she faces life in jail or a secure psychiatric hospital, or the chance of rehabilitation and release. Psychological thriller, starring Emily Watson and Denise Gough.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: Let Magic be the soundtrack to your late night listening with some of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a 56-year-old Citroen 2CV in the south of France. However, with age comes problems, and expert mechanic Edd China needs to strip it back to its bare bones to breathe new life into the vehicle, as almost every aspect of the quirky car requires attention.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators in Wisconsin try to unravel the mystery of a house fire that may have been deliberately set to destroy evidence of a more heinous crime. Plus, in Florida an arsonist is linked to a series of fatal fires.
